III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Compliance with child protection law; development of plan
Title required.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4131
Section (1) The licensee shall develop and implement a written plan to
Description assure compliance with the child protection law, 1975 PA 238,
MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation An individual posted on social media that they were serving a
Genesse Sherrif with a lawsuit/complaint, alleging that the sheriff
failed to investigate allegations of sexual abuse that occurred
during the youth's placement at the facility the summer of 2022
(May 11, 2022).
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was contacted by email on 02/26/2025.
Complainant provided documentation on 03/03/2025 of Former
Youth (FY) filing of a lawsuit on 02/15/2025 against a law
enforcement agency and two specific individuals within the law
enforcement agency. FY’s lawsuit alleges the law enforcement
agency and the two agency persons covered up and refused to
investigate his allegation of being sexually abused when he
resided at Mott Childrens Residence.
Unsuccessful attempts to reach FY by phone were made on
04/18/2025 and 04/28/2025.
Director of Residential (DOR) was interviewed on 04/28/2025 by
phone. DOR stated being aware of FY’s allegation. DOR stated
she and Former Staff 2 (FS2) physically managed FY when he
tried to bar arm choke Former Staff 3 (FS3). DOR stated Former
Staff 1 (FS1) also assisted in FY’s physical management, which
was a prone restraint on the ground by the back entrance of the
main building. DOR stated FS1 likely secured one of FY’s
shoulder area because FY headbutted FS1 and knocked out his
front tooth. DOR stated she did not witness anything inappropriate
or sexual in FY’s physical management. DOR stated FS3 was not
involved in the physical management of FY.
FS1, FS2 and FS3 were not interviewed because they are no
longer employed at Mott Childrens Residence and their current
contact information is unknown.
2

Chief Operating Officer (COO) was interviewed on 02/25/2025
and 03/24/2025. COO stated FY was at Mott Childrens Residence
in 2016. COO stated FY did not report a sexual abuse allegation
and the agency did not suspect or receive an allegation about FY
being sexually abused at Mott Childrens Residence while FY was
in care at the facility. COO stated Michigan State Police
completed an investigation in 2023 regarding FY’s allegation of
being sexually assaulted at Mott Childrens Residence and nothing
was found.
Documentation
MiSACWIS review shows the following:
• FY was born in 10/2002.
• FY was placed at Mott Childrens Residence on 04/22/2016.
• FY was replaced to Genesee Valley Regional Center on
11/19/2016 and did not return to Mott Childrens Residence.
• FY was officially discharged from Mott Childrens Residence
on 11/24/2016.
Incident report dated 08/25/2016 at 7:15 PM to 7:28 PM states FY
became agitated when he did not receive a haircut. FY followed a
staff to the main building and tried to take coffee, use the front
desk phone and break into offices. FY did not comply with
redirection and escalated his behaviors by throwing trash cans,
pushing staff and trying to bar arm choke a staff. One staff came
and assisted in physically managing FY to the ground in a prone
position. Another staff came to assist in the physical management
and FY headbutted this staff and chipped this staff’s tooth. FY was
released and redirected to sit up when blood was noticed in FY’s
mouth. FY de-escalated and taken to urgent care. (Note: Prone
restraints were permitted in 2016.)
08/25/2016 Hurley Medical Center Urgent Care report diagnosed
FY with a chin abrasion without infection and a puncture wound
inside his mouth. FY stated he obtained the injuries when he was
“taken down” to the cement ground and hit his mouth.
Nursing physical restraint observation follow up note dated
08/26/2016 at 11:05 AM states FY’s emotional state was observed
as content and guilty. It states FY bit his tooth into his lip in the
restraint on 08/25/2016.
Nursing progress note dated 08/30/2016 states FY re-evaluated
for his face and mouth injuries. FY directed to continue with salt-
water rinses after eating and to wash his chin abrasion twice a day
with soap and water.
3

A review of MiSACWIS intakes and DCWL investigations did not
find any allegations of sexual abuse investigated that involved FY
during his time at Mott Childrens Residence.
Michigan Department of State Police incident report filed by FY on
03/06/2023 states FY alleged a local law enforcement agency did
not take his sexual abuse report on 05/11/2022 and this was
another attempt through Michigan Department of State Police. FY
alleged he was sexually assaulted by a male staff during a
physical management on or about 08/25/2016. Michigan State
Police Officer (MSPO) interviewed a total of four current and
former employees of Mott Children Residence that were allegedly
involved in FY’s physical management on 08/25/2016. One of the
interviewees was not involved in FY’s physical management.
Another interviewee is the alleged perpetrator. Two other
interviewees were involved in FY’s physical management. Each
interviewee did not support FY’s allegation. MSPO reported FY’s
allegation to Adult Protective Services and it was not investigated.
MSPO informed FY via text on 06/21/2023 that a chief assistant
prosecuting attorney denied the case.
02/26/2025 email from Central Intake states this allegation was
transferred to law enforcement.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance because Mott Childrens
Residence staff did not suspect child abuse or neglect when
Former Youth was physically managed on or about 08/25/2016
and therefore did not make a child abuse and neglect report.
Michigan Department of State Police completed an incident report,
which was denied on 06/21/2023 by a chief assistant prosecuting
attorney, regarding FY’s allegation of sexual assault on or about
08/25/2016 at Mott Childrens Residence.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
